impConfig.rootCommandDescription: CA Endevor SCM plug-in for listing Endevor environment information, working with elements and packages located in specified Endevor instance.
impConfig.name: endevor

schema.title: The CA Endevor SCM endevor profile
schema.description: The CA Endevor SCM endevor profile schema, where you specify your endevor session information and credentials

optionDefinition.description: The hostname of the endevor session
optionDefinition.name: host

optionDefinition.description: The port number of the endevor session
optionDefinition.name: port

optionDefinition.description: The username of the endevor session
optionDefinition.name: user

optionDefinition.description: The password of the user
optionDefinition.name: password

optionDefinition.description: The protocol used for connecting to CA Endevor SCM Rest API
optionDefinition.name: protocol

optionDefinition.description: The base path used for connecting to CA Endevor SCM Rest API
optionDefinition.name: base-path

optionDefinition.description: If set, the server certificate is verified against the list of supplied CAs
optionDefinition.name: reject-unauthorized

createProfileExamples.options: ndvrSample --host ndvr123 --port 8080 --user ibmuser --password myp4ss --prot http --base-path  EndevorService/api/v2 --reject-unauthorized false
createProfileExamples.description: Create an endevor profile called 'ndvrSample' to connect to CA Endevor SCM web services at host ndvr123 and port 8080,using http protocol, with / EndevorService/api/v2 base path, allowing self-signed certificates

schema.title: The CA Endevor SCM element inventory location specification profile
schema.description: The CA Endevor SCM element location, where you specify your working environment, system and subsystem

optionDefinition.description: The STC/datasource of the session
optionDefinition.name: instance

optionDefinition.description: The CA Endevor SCM environment where your project resides
optionDefinition.name: environment

optionDefinition.description: The CA Endevor SCM system where the element resides
optionDefinition.name: system

optionDefinition.description: The CA Endevor SCM subsystem where your element resides
optionDefinition.name: subsystem

optionDefinition.description: Name of the CA Endevor SCM element's type
optionDefinition.name: type

optionDefinition.description: The CA Endevor SCM stage where your project resides
optionDefinition.name: stage-number

optionDefinition.description: The CA Endevor SCM comment you want to use when performing an action
optionDefinition.name: comment

optionDefinition.description: The CA Endevor SCM CCID you want to use when performing an action
optionDefinition.name: ccid

optionDefinition.description: The return code of CA Endevor SCM that defines a failed action
optionDefinition.name: maxrc

createProfileExamples.options: ndvrLoc --env ENV --sys SYS --sub SUBSYS --typ COBOL --sn 1 -i ENDEVOR
createProfileExamples.description: Create a location profile called 'ndvrLoc' to work at CA Endevor SCM location ENV/1/SYS/SUBSYS, with elements of type COBOL, using CA Endevor SCM web services configuration ENDEVOR
Create a location profile called 'ndvrLoc2' to work at CA Endevor SCM location ENV/1/SYS/SUBSYS, using CCID 'CCID' and comment 'sample comment'

impConfig.rootCommandDescription: Validates the accuracy of job control language (JCL) and also helps identify execution-time errors, such as security violations and missing data sets that could cause jobs to fail.
impConfig.name: jclcheck

schema.title: JCLCheck Profile
schema.description: A JCLCheck profile is required to issue commands in the jcl command group that interact with JCLCheck. The JCLCheck profile contains your host and port for the JCLCheck instance of your choice.

optionDefinition.name: host
optionDefinition.description: Host name of the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

optionDefinition.name: port
optionDefinition.description: Port for the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

optionDefinition.name: user
optionDefinition.description: User name for authenticating connections to the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

optionDefinition.name: password
optionDefinition.description: Password for authenticating connections to the JCLCheck API service that is running on the mainframe system.

optionDefinition.name: base-path
optionDefinition.description: The base path for your API mediation layer instance. Specify this option to prepend the base path to all resources when making REST requests. Do not specify this option if you are not using an API mediation layer.

optionDefinition.name: reject-unauthorized
optionDefinition.description: Reject self-signed certificates.

optionDefinition.name: protocol
optionDefinition.description: Specifies protocol to use for JCLCheck connection (http or https).

optionDefinition.name: jclcheck-options
optionDefinition.description: The desired set of JCLCheck runtime options. Specify the options exactly as you would on the PARM= or OPTIONS DD on a batch run of JCLCheck. See the JCLCheck runtime options documentation for details on available runtime options. If you specify options that change the format of the JCLCheck reports, you should request '--raw-output'. Changing the format of the report will affect the ability to produce a structured API response.

createProfileExamples.description: Create a JCLCheck profile named 'jcl123' to run JCLCheck at host zos123 and port 1234

createProfileExamples.options: jcl123 --host zos123 --port 1234 --user ibmuser --pass myp4ss --jo "NOAS NOAU NOHCD NOJCL NORES NOSIGN"
createProfileExamples.description: Create a JCLCheck profile with default set of JCLCheck runtime options specified
